rundown: 4-1 W vs Chicago Cubs Bryce Elder: 6.1 innings, 1 earned run, 5 hits, 0 HR, 6 strikeouts Batters: Matt Olson (2 hits - 4 AB, 1 HR, 1 RBI) Ozzie Albies (1 hit - 3 AB, 1 HR, 1 RBI) Drake Baldwin (1 hit - 3 AB, 0 HR, 1 RBI) The Braves secured a solid victory against the Chicago Cubs, showcasing strong pitching and timely hitting. Bryce Elder delivered an impressive performance on the mound, allowing only one earned run while striking out six batters. Key highlights include: 1. Matt Olson and Ozzie Albies both contributed with home runs, providing crucial runs for the Braves. 2. Drake Baldwin added to the scoring with an RBI, helping to extend the lead. 3. The Braves' defense was effective, limiting the Cubs to just five hits throughout the game.
